perturbation.original_text: Such amounts shall be billed on a bi-monthly basis by Equidata and are due and payable in full by Marketing Affiliate 30 days from the invoice date. The prices set forth in Exhibit A do not include regulatory fees, sales tax, excise tax or any other fees or taxes that may be charged by states or local taxing authorities nor does it include additional fees or surcharges, including specific area Affiliate charges that may be accessed by the Credit Reporting Agencies (CRA's).
perturbation.changed_text: Such amounts shall be billed on a bi-monthly basis by Equidata and are due and payable in full by Marketing Affiliate 60 days from the invoice date. The prices set forth in Exhibit A do not include regulatory fees, sales tax, excise tax or any other fees or taxes that may be charged by states or local taxing authorities nor does it include additional fees or surcharges, including specific area Affiliate charges that may be accessed by the Credit Reporting Agencies (CRA's).
perturbation.explanation: Extended payment terms to 60 days without any written agreement, conflicting with standard business practice and potentially violating prompt payment laws depending on specific goods or services provided and the jurisdiction. If the parties don't agree to it by their signature, it doesn't apply.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state prompt payment laws.

perturbation.original_text: Marketing Affiliate shall give Equidata written demand of dispute within 10 days of the due date of the invoice. The demand shall set forth a statement for the nature of the dispute and the amount involved. If Equidata and Marketing Affiliate can not resolve the dispute on their own within 10 days after Equidata receive said dispute, the parties shall jointly select an arbitrator.
perturbation.changed_text: Marketing Affiliate shall give Equidata written demand of dispute within 5 days of the due date of the invoice. The demand shall set forth a statement for the nature of the dispute and the amount involved. If Equidata and Marketing Affiliate can not resolve the dispute on their own within 3 days after Equidata receive said dispute, the parties shall jointly select an arbitrator.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allowed for 10 days for disputes, which is a reasonable time frame, the time has been reduced to 5 days, and a subsequent 3 days to resolve, this can be considered too short amount of time to raise a legitimate dispute, potentially violating fair business practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of fair business practices.

perturbation.original_text: Such approval shall not be unreasonably withheld and shall be completed within 48 hours of receipt of Marketing Materials for review.
